If we need to return to the area, we would definitely stay there again.

The bed is super comfortable( ive stayed in tons of air bnbs and this is far the best sleep Ive ever had)
The pool is just right it has a shallow and deep end and in the right season is amazing to enjoy. Although the house is attached we had all the privacy we asked for!
It is 40 minutes from Corning Museum of Glass and Watkins Glen park which are the two musts when visiting!
Check-in is super easy as well, which is important after a long drive! We brought our dog and she had ample space to run and I felt super safe leaving her while we went to the museum! Thank you Abra well be back !!!

I wish that I could give this home 10 stars. My Husband and I are from the area but live out of state now. We traveled home for our wedding week and needed our own space with our fur babies. Not only was Abraâ€™s home beautiful and peaceful, she had EVERYTHING one could possibly need. Upon arrival we noticed that the fridge was stocked with waters, eggs, coffee creamer, and syrup (all the things people usually forget to bring with them). The coffee bar was easily the highlight of the kitchen amenities!!
In the bathroom there were even extra toiletries for guest that may have forgotten some essentials!
The hospitality, communication, and flexibility has been unmatched to any of our previous Air BnB stays. Highly recommend and given our frequent visits to the area, we will definitely be returning!

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Overall we had a good stay! We came up to visit my son for the weekend who is a student at Mansfield and this worked out because it is only about 30 minutes from campus. The farmhouse has all amenities of home (minutes a microwave) with a huge bathroom, fireplace and a nice firepit with firewood provided. There were also sanitary napkins available in the bathroom which came in handy. There is also a dog and cat that roams around. The only things I noticed were the steps are wobbly coming up onto the porch, the bedrooms do not have dedicated doors; they have barn doors which can be difficult maneuver (declined to have the host fix it when I brought it to her attention) so you can't fully close off the bedrooms. There is a lot of road noise, so if you are a light sleeper you will not enjoy the location. Communication was fine while we were there but beforehand it was slow and I had to follow up each time before receiving a response which is surprising for a super host.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

Â·
August 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: I've always wanted to milk a cow. As a child, when I saw people on TV struggling to work the teets with their hands, I always thought I'd be able to do it better. I still have yet to experience that (or be proven wrong), but at age 59, this tranquil setting with the cows nearby is just perfect for my sensibilities. What an incredible view of undulating hills and farmlands stretching to the horizon. I spent a night in this lovely farmhouse with my husband and two dogs while doing some work in Athens, PA, as an alternative to a very expensive average chain hotel in the area. What an absolute treat. And since it was toward the end of our long road trip from Chicago, I was able to watch TV, get online to catch up on work, and finish a load of laundry before going to bed. But the most memorable piece was taking the dogs out for a last walk and finding a full moon so bright, we could see our shadows as we walked the vast lawn between the house and two barns with the sounds of cows stirring.

review_text: First off, this is a very cozy place to stay and perfect for people who donâ€™t mind lack of privacy. It is a shared farmhouse and it is clean. Had a shower and tub showed in the pictures and washer and dryer. The kitchen has a range and full size fridge and freezer but there was no microwave but they had a 3-in-1 toaster oven, 3 cup coffee pot, and grill. Sink area with plenty of dishes and silverware. The bedroom with the queen size bed has one power outlet which is enough if you donâ€™t need to plug in a lot of stuff. There were two tvs in the place. Plenty of extra bedding if needed. The cows were cute. It is next to a busy road so you have the noise from that and light from a street light shining in the bedroom window. Despite all that it was still worth it for us and we found it cute and cozy.

review_text: My husband, dog and I were staying here while visiting with family over the holidays. I met our host, Nancy, right when we arrived and she showed me around, introduced me to their horses and even let our dog run around in their horse arena. The hosts were beyond lovely and very accommodating. The cabin was cozy and quaint and while the bathroom is about 100 yards away in their barn, there was a porta potty we could use right next to the cabin. It was a charming little holiday getaway and we would for sure stay again.

review_text: We were recently in Athens, PA for a work event and came across this little gem. The host provided some snacks and water, which was so appreciated after a long day filled with work AND travel! She was also super responsive and thorough with directions/instructions. The cabin itself is quaint, comfortable and clean. From the surrounding hills to the sparkling stars above, the views are absolutely incredible here. We truly enjoyed disconnecting alongside nature and a crackling fire. Not to mention, it's on a horse farm so we actually took some riding lessons before checking out. I was anxious as a first-time rider, but our host, Nancy, made me feel more at ease and is just the sweetest soul!! We look forward to visiting again -- thank you for a lovely stay :)

review_text: This is such a unique and beautiful property. I stayed for one night and the hosts were very helpful and responsive. The cabin was new and clean - oh, and it DOES have air conditioning! I was cool and comfortable on a hot night. Even though it's a small and cozy space, I felt like I had plenty of room for my suitcase and belongings. The hosts provided a mini fridge (stocked with water bottles), snacks, a coffee maker, and coffee. The porch was lovely and I was encouraged to walk around to greet the horses and cows (which I did, happily!). As is advertised, the bathroom is 100 yards away, but it is brand new and I had no problem with it. The hosts provided all linens and basic toiletries. I was only their second guest, so I'm sure they are still getting into their airbnb groove, but I couldn't tell because they seemed like pros. I had a great experience and would love to go back sometime!

You don't always get what you, but sometimes you get what you need.
I was in a last minute rush and didn't read the listing properly. The beautiful little cabin wasn't what I was expecting. (Literacy is importance, kids.)
No Wi-Fi? Strolls past horses to use the bathroom?
Turns out it was exactly what I needed during a very chaotic family visit. Beautiful view at sunset. Very comfy bed.
Nancy is incredibly kind and they respond very quickly to messages. Great snacks. Little creamer pods (instead of the powdered creamer usually reserved for guests you don't actually like).
Plus the horses are rad. When's the last time you hung out with a horse?

review_text: If youâ€™re looking for a city getaway, look no further! This is your dream spot! We really enjoyed our stay at Cyndiâ€™s. The house was very charming and spacious. The kitchen was well stocked with all essentials. The bathroom was cozy and warm. The beds and linens were super comfortable and clean to the point that we wanted to sleep in all day. We had the best communication with Shannon (Cyndiâ€™s cohost) since Day 1 and throughout our stay. Shannon made herself available for us for anything we would need. She was kind, she checked in with us via text every morning. We swung by the city center of Owego as Shannon recommended. We unbelievably spent solid 4hrs in the gigantic antique mall there. Cyndi and Shannon were so considered. They welcomed us with a gift basket and a box of goodies that survived us the first night we arrived, after our 4hr drive. We loved the location of the house; it was away from neighbors and we felt like we had the world to ourselves. We ran outside with our Corgi pup and chased after him, we played in snow, and a lot more. The house had everything for everyone. High speed internet, smart TV and you name it. You wonâ€™t regret staying here. We will come again.

That is enough to make the trip to her farm worth it but on top of that she let my daughter and I help with all the animals, which is her happiest place. The farmhouse is so eclectic and well decorated we loved it! There is a bucolic babbling brook behind the house and a flock of cardinals were at the bird feeder in the morning. It was cold, snowy and still so lovely but the 2nd bedroom is not heated if cold be sure to ask for heaters and keep door open. If you want to use the jetted tub I would ask in advance itâ€™s a process. It is a little house right off the road but I saw maybe three cars go by.Definitely one of my favorite stays we could be here forever and the town is very cute eat @MJâ€™s unforgettable with the best view of the river

name: JJ & Sarah

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We had a fantastic stay at Hunter's family farm! She is so warm and welcoming, and her family's farm and property are just full of charm. We felt right at home with everything we needed. We love historic homes and really enjoyed being surrounded by all of the built in features of Hunter's home, as well as her lovely and interesting antique furnishings. She even let our son get his piano practice in on one of her antique uprights. Communications with her were a breeze. She let us know ahead of time that cel. service is spotty as you near her property so we came prepared with screenshots of the check in instructions/door access code/WiFi - that was a huge help. Our 11 year old son loved playing in the creek every morning, I went for some great runs on the logging road on her property, and Hunter gave our whole family (including my parents whom we were in town to visit) a hands-on tour of the farm complete with opportunities to feed the animals and check out the old barn. Upon our arrival there was a huge gift basket filled with local treats, bath supplies, snacks and other goodies. That was a really nice touch that we appreciated and found really helpful. It was a very pleasant and easy drive into the town of Owego. We enjoyed it so much we will definitely stay there again on future visits, and my parents are going to recommend Hunter's place to other visiting family and friends. We also want to come back to hear about how Hunter's creative plans are going - she's quite the entrepreneurial, creative, Rennaissance women! If you're looking for a charming country place to stay in the area, look no further!

review_text:
We were looking for an Airbnb for a quiet weekend and Tucked Inn totally delivered! The home sits on a working farm with pasture and woodlands. Immediately behind the house are walking trails that the owners have created. They even provided a hand drawn map displaying the points of interest. We were so intrigued to see the taps in the maple trees and the network of hoses to collect the sap.
The weather was not the greatest the weekend we came. We brought food with us to prepare. You never know how equipped a kitchen in an Airbnb is going to be. This kitchen was the best equipped kitchen Iâ€™ve stayed in. Thereâ€™s a 5 burner Samsung range that was up to the challenge. The hosts provided Viking cookware. There were plenty of mixing bowls, utensils, virtually anything you could possible need, even a Cuisinart stand mixer. Outside there is a Cuisinart 6 burner gas grill that was clean and easy to use. Comfy recliners in the living room and comfy bedding and thick towels. Highly recommend

review_text: My mom and I decided to escape to the peace and tranquility of the Tucked Inn from our apartment in the big city, and for eight glorious days, it did not disappoint. Upon arrival, we loved the chalkboard sign that welcomed us, as well as the refrigerator that was stocked with fresh home-made chocolate chip cookie dough, farm fresh eggs, milk and pure maple syrup produced on the farm that is owned by our fantastic hosts, Andrew and Sally. They are located down the road from Tucked Inn and readily available to assist with any questions or concerns. We loved the RTV tour that they offer of their property, and the sweeping views of hills of Bradford & Susquehanna Counties. And as rural as the area is, the Tri-Cities (Binghamton-Johnson City-Endicott) of New York's Southern Tier are only 30-35 minutes away. Highly recommend!

review_text:
The house is rustic with a log cabin feel. Lots of exposed beams and big game on the walls. It is spacious well laid out, comfortably furnished, and has all the amenities, even WiFi and a game area in the garage. We loved the open plan kitchen/dining/living/loft area; itâ€™s perfect for a family gathering. It sleeps 9 adults comfortably, making it well worth the cost. It is also very private, on top of a hill with nice views of fields, woods, and Sayre in the distance. Weather didnâ€™t allow us to use the pool or hot tub, but they looked inviting.
The recommended road is a bit of a challenge, especially in bad weather or in the dark, though there is a better road once you know where to go (but you must watch for the kamikaze dogs!)
JoAnn is a perfect host: friendly and helpful when needed and invisible otherwise, even though she seems to live very close by.
Everyone in our group was very pleased and we would definitely return.

We picked blueberries, watched some beautiful sunsets, went exploring and 4 wheeling through the woods while seeing some cool wildlife. Met some super sweet pups, played in the pool and relaxed in the hot tub. Giant bon fires, good food and family.
It seems the Beemans have thought of just about everything to make your vacation at their family home a fun and memorable experience.
Eight of us visited including kids ages 2, 6 & 8 and nana, 75, and we ALL had an equally wonderful time. Cannot say enough great things about this place, we will all recommend to anybody willing to listen. Driving home and the whole car is already asking to go back!
If youâ€™re looking for a place to get away from the craziness and everyday hustle and bustle, this is your place.

A very kind neighbor brought us freshly picked blueberries and the host was very responsive- including when we locked ourselves out of the house!
It's a place to relax and disconnect. If you need to stay digitally connected- as I had to due to some work related loose ends-  you may have to rely on your hotspot as Wifi connection is pretty intermittent. (there is reliable cable TV if you just need entertainment).
However if your plan is to disconnect from the hustle and bustle then the place is ideal to relax and soak up the pastoral landscape.

name: Catherine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2022

Group trip
review_text: This is our 2nd stay here and every time we go we wind up bringing more and more people with us and still have a ton of room left over the house is big enough to host well over 50 people comfortably inside and outside you can have a 500 party easy That's how big it is this Is a 300 acre property with about I don't even know how many trails . they let you borrow the koboda I forget exactly what it's called But I think that's the name and We had a 20' fire. they Redid the garage added a ping pong table and Official foosball table (when We last stayed we were the 3rd person to actually stay there It's nice to see what was added and rearranged). the basement has some big arcade machine That Has pacman and galactica I think there's maybe 5 different games in there there's karaoke and a bunch of other stuff . They have 2 separate bars they have ample amounts of room. the Jacuzzi is off the wall. We had fun barbecuing all nights. Joanne and Steve are super friendly Scott helped us fix the heater for the poo.l We had so much fun and they are super nice. the property is amazing the views are breathtaking you can see at least 10 mountains from their hill, they have a restaurant where you can eat at if you would like . is it awesome They was an ice cream shop right there a great antique shop there's so much to do and see they have wild Life right up to the house We saw a frog rabbit hummingbird deer. The kids had a lot of fun as well And weren't bored at all. The dog had fun running around the property. Absolutely love all of the beds they were so comfortable and the new Carpet. There is also a hidden gem right over the hill and let me tell you it is amazing you can barbecue there they have swings there they have a bad swing they have a huge ponds where you can kayak you can fish so make sure you grab some Arsenals because they also have another pet actually and about the pond over the hill you will not be disappointed. You can walk it or you can just take the kobota right over. My friends want to rebook and my boyfriend and I would love to rebook in the fall as well.

name: Amy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This beautiful log home was both spacious and comfortable for a get away with our son's family. As we drove up the long mountain dirt lane, surrounded by forest, we knew it was the perfect place for us. JoAnn was a super host who quickly responded to any questions we had. She even left us a welcome basket of fresh baked muffins that were tasty with morning coffee and tea. The furnishings were comfortable and the kitchen was equipped with most everything we needed to prepare family meals for our 3 night vacation. We enjoyed our evenings around the beautiful stone hearth wood stove with a glass front to watch the flickering flames. The hot tub was so nice. We enjoyed making gingerbread houses in the large dining area with the grandchildren. And walks on the property held beautiful views. We hope to return in warm weather to enjoy the pool and longer hikes with more of our family. And we look forward to time around the huge fire pit come warmer weather. We highly recommend this beautiful home for a quiet country stay with friends and family. Thankyou to the Beeman family for sharing your home!

name: Blair
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had the most magical stay at Joanneâ€™s home. This was the perfect place to come and unwind for the week with our dog. We loved the hikes and the breathtaking scenery. Joann and her family are just so hospitable. We arrived to fresh baked cookies and a hand written card, and the experience only improved from there. Each element of the home felt designed to improve the experience as much as possible- from the outdoor dining and rocking chair set up, to the roofing choice that let just the right amount of light in when you are enjoying your outdoor hot tub experience. When we had trouble getting the fan to work, the family was super responsive, and talked us through fixing the problem. Itâ€™s clear that a lot of love and time have been poured into this place, and we were so lucky to be able to experience it.
Some things I donâ€™t think have been mentioned before we came- the beds are super comfortable. We stayed in the downstairs king bed, which was a tempurpedic. We saw tons of wild life, including deer and even an eagle! There were blackberry bushes scattered along the trails, and the berries were in season! Stuck inside on a rainy day? There are tons of dvds and board games. The garage is a game room complete with a ping pong table and Mrs. Pac-Man set up!
I could probably also dedicate an entire paragraph to Bob, the resident cat. Bob seems to live in the garage, but will sneak insight the main house if you leave the door open (a welcome companion). I donâ€™t think I have ever met a nicer, more gentle cat in my whole life. My puppy just loved him and Bob... well Bob was shockingly tolerant of his antics!
Just a few things to mention that were not cons, but things to consider. The wifi set up is actually a verizon jet pack hotspot, with a monthly data limit. We arrived on the 26th of the month, and there was no data available. We were able to use data on our phones, but it was spotty. Honestly, this was a great way to disconnect for me (and what a beautiful place to do it) but this amazing stay might not be your first pick if you need to -say- work remotely with internet access. One other small thing to note is that the grill could use a deep cleaning. We did what we could, but Iâ€™d recommend you keep an eye out to make sure none of the grease catches fire during use.
In all Iâ€™d rate our stay a 20/10. We (and our pup) canâ€™t wait to go back!

review_text: Iâ€™m hesitant to write my review because I wish I could hide this amazing home so that we can book it again and again but then I would be robbing other families of the opportunity to stay at the absolute best Airbnb! From the minute we arrived at the house we felt welcome and at home by fresh baked cookies chocolates and a hand written note from JoAnn followed by a big hello from Steve who was already working on the biggest firepit we have ever seen! The house was huge but cozy and the pictures donâ€™t do it justice at all! From the huge bedrooms to the wet bar and balcony and patios it was an endless space for the kiddies to stretch out. It was well equipped for everything and anything with fully stocked cabinets of more pots pans utensils and gadgets than I have in my own home. Plenty of towels blankets washer dryer board games and movies galore! The hot tub was amazing and huge! Plenty of privacy but JoAnn Steve and Wendy were just a call or holler away if need anything but there was nothing to be needed. Getting a private atv tour from Steve of their massive property on the mountain was the highlight of our trip! A pond a creek tons of walking and riding trails and plenty of dogs to pet and even a cat that loves hugs made this place better than any stay at a resort. The Beemans are lucky and blessed to be able to have this place and give others the opportunity to make memories with families and friends. There is nothing they could have done to make our stay better and I just hope they decide to keep their home on Airbnb for many years to come because we will be a repeat visitor for sure and could see this being our familyâ€™s goto place for as long as they will let us!

Such a friendly family, JoAnn was super communicative and Steven was so helpful and nice. We enjoyed talking to him and meeting his amazing dogs.
The house itself was perfect for our needs, sparklying clean, spacious, large open kitchen, beautiful firewood stove, plenty of space to relax, comfortable beds and bedrooms, all the linens and towels were fresh and clean. The house was equipped with EVERYTHING you may need.
We really enjoyed cooking and talking at the same time since the open and large kitchen is very conducive to this.
We LOVED the hut tub, which was already warm when we got there (so was the fire), after a warm hot tub hangout, make your way to the fireplace for a cozy nightcap, and in the morning enjoy the beautiful view off the kitchen while sipping some tea/coffee.
Steve also built a huge bonfire and we were able to get it going on our last full day, so much fun.
Our dogs really enjoyed exploring the woods and running around the open field with all the snow.
We had a beautiful and relaxing time in your wonderful property and are super excited to come back in the future.
Thank you JoAnn and Steven for sharing your family home with us. Thank you again for a wonderful time, we will be back!!!

name: Kat
rating_info:

Stayed about a week
review_text: My partner and I are so grateful to JoAnn and her family for the opportunity to stay at their idyllic family cabin. As a fellow next-generation-family-home trustee, I really appreciate the fact that the Beeman siblings are doing all they can to keep the property in their family's name - and that we got to benefit from it. The property and the cabin are incredibly spacious. Visiting during the pandemic, it was a perfect place to get away from the city. Despite the fact that we only left the cabin to pick up provisions before a snow storm, we still felt like we had novelty in our experience every day. The wood burning stove was a particular highlight of our cozy stay, as well as the hot tub, which we got to enjoy as the snow fell around us. We were also so grateful to be able to bring our dogs with us for our stay. Living in a city, we need to be vigilant the second we walk out our door, with cars, people, and other dogs. Being able to let them outside and run freely immediately - I don't know that I have ever seen them so happy! Our puppy also got to experience his first snow at the cabin, which is a memory we will always cherish. We are very hopeful to return to the cabin in the future - and hope that as the pandemic ends we'll be able to bring some friends with us next time. Thank you for all of your assistance in facilitating a much-needed and very relaxing week away!

review_text:
The cozy country retreat was the post wedding retreat location my wife and I took right after our wedding, and it truly did not disappoint! Jana has cultivated a bird oasis right outside of the Airbnb unit (through the use of many flowers and birdhouses), and as lovers of all things outdoors, my wife and I were drawn to the many up-close avian visitors (house finches, golden finches, and hummingbirds!). In the mornings, we ate breakfast outside with the birds. In the evening, we put a fire on in the firepit (supplies provided) and sipped champagne that Jana gave to us! Jana also made a unique windowpane art piece in the outdoor space that commemorated our wedding day! At every turn, each and every little detail in the Airbnb unit was addressed by Jana, and our experience was simply delightful because of it. Truly a hidden gem.
(My wife and I also drove to downtown Owego to do the riverfront walk after getting dinner at Jackpot Ritchie's Chicken BBQ - definitely recommend!)

Even though she was coming back from a trip herself, she was very quick to respond and able to setup everything in such a way that I couldnâ€™t believe it all came together so perfectly.

name: Peggy

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Some places have the scenery, others great amenities and hospitality, but the Cozy Country Retreat is the total package - by far the most delightful, serene, and scenic getaway of our traveling experience. Attention to detail and beautiful touches were everywhere: original paintings, stained glass, small vases of yellow daisies, objets dâ€™art on shelves, homemade soap in the bathroom. A lot of love went into creating this inviting place. The spacious kitchen was stocked with baskets of snacks, fixings for sâ€™mores, and wine. The patio overlooking a lush green valley and surrounding hills was also thoughtfully arranged, with a fire pit, plentiful seating, fountain, and rustic yard decor like old wagon wheels that sparkled with fairy lights at night. The bird watching was phenomenal. As beautiful and comfortable as the apartment was, I was continually drawn to the patio. Jana and George were consummate hosts, just the right combination of checking on us for our needs, respecting our privacy, and offering suggestions for sightseeing and a special restaurant for our anniversary.

review_text:
If you are considering visiting the Finger Lakes area look no further than Janaâ€™s â€œCozy Country Retreatâ€
Jana is an outstanding host for whom nothing is too much, her warm welcome made us feel so comfortable and along with her husband George, they were so attentive to any of our needs or questions.
The property is furnished to the highest standard, a most comfortable bed, a great TV, two leather recliners, all the kitchen equipment you will need whether cooking in or just having breakfast.
The outside area is well equipped including access to homegrown tomatoes on the vine!! There is a fire pit with wood provided and very comfy chairs and loungers for outdoor eating and drinking.
The township of Owego is only 10minutes drive away where you will find a fine grocery store ( Price Chopper) and loads of restaurants. If you play golf make sure you go to En-Joie golf course in Endicott about 30 minutes drive.
Janaâ€™s property cannot be over praised, it does not get any better than this, a true 5 star AirBnB.
Book this property you will not be disappointed.

review_text:
Driving up Jana and George's driveway, you will immediately be in awe of their beautiful home, and upon turning around, you are greeted by a great view. This view can be enjoyed from the patio (with the added perk of a fire pit). Regardless of what you have planned during your trip, ensure you set aside time for a breakfast on the patio, and an evening of smores on the firepit...even if this means extending your stay for a day!
Jana and George truly go above and beyond to ensure their guests are comfortable and all needs are met. The welcome basket and cold beverages were greatly appreciated after a long drive and allowed us to unwind on the patio for a bit, rather than immediately heading to the grocery store.
Their place is cozy and homey, but modern and with some luxuries. Perfect combination to feel like you're at a home away from home while also feeling pampered!
Lastly, not only are Jana and George great hosts, but they are also great people. Conversation is easy, they are very thoughtful and considerate, and you can't help but feel like you're chatting with a family friend. They even sent us off with some fresh goodies from the garden!
If you are looking to stay near Owego, this is THE place to stay....highly recommended!

If you get a chance to stay at the Cozy Cottage, snap it up! The setting on the top of a gentle hill provides a lovely view from the private patio complete with a fire pit. Morning coffee on the patio was accompanied by birds singing and a hummingbird. The apartment has a roomy open concept living room/ kitchen. The kitchen is fully equipped in case you want do some cooking. The queen size bed is comfortable but a little high if you are especially short. There is a well appointed bathroom with a shower and granite topped vanity. Everything is very comfortable and lovingly decorated.
The Cozy Cottage is located 10-15 minutes from Owego where you can find both fast food and nice restaurants, drug stores, etc. Ithaca, located on Cayuga Lake and the home of Cornell University, is within easy driving distance.
The host, Jana, and her family, including the family pets, were vey friendly and welcoming. They all are dedicated to making sure guests have a wonderful experience. I fully intend to go back.

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had such a great stay at Cabin in the Clouds! The cabin has all the essentials. We brought a small propane camp stove which we found to be incredibly helpful to cook outside. A sharp knife and a couple of cooking utensils were of help to bring as well.
The double bed was extremely comfortable. And we were more than cozy with the space heaters. The complimentary firewood was a lovely addition. We found ourselves outside around the fire most nights. In the mornings and afternoons we got to watch the bluebirds
Even though the cabin is closer to the road, we rarely saw cars or people. It was a very private stay. We had pretty okay cell phone reception -- definitely enough to send and receive messages and make calls in case of emergency, even enough to stream some music.
For fun we traveled about an hour to hike Rickett's Glen, which was well worth the drive. Tons of amazing waterfalls. But go on the early side, as it gets crowded fast. If you're looking for the most simple perfect stay, this is it. We couldn't be happier with our experience!

Hello Sean,
Thank you very much for allowing us the use of your homely, comfortable, and well maintained home. All of us thoroughly enjoyed our stay at your home. Your generosity, and Alan explaining everything to us made our stay even more pleasant. We have checked out of your beautiful home with happy memories.
Once again, I thank you for all your help and for allowing us the use of your home. Hopefully, next year, during the next graduation ceremony, We will surely consider staying at your beautiful and comfortable home again.
We wish you all the very best, and may God bless you and your family always and abundantly. May you continue to host many more families in the years to come. May the excellent services at your beautiful home continue to be enjoyed by the guests visiting your beautiful home.
Best wishes
Jimmy Puthumana & family

review_text: My 5 yr old daughter and I found Sean's cabin while attending a dog show nearby in Apalachin. And I wish I could give more than 5 stars for the location along with other things!! The views were STUNNING... it was hard to take my eyes off the sweeping landscape, regardless of time of day! The cabin has ample and comfortable space for a family. And everything is there that you could possibly need (and the owners provide water which is such a nice and unexpected added touch!). The bathroom appears to have been renovated recently and was updated and clean. The space was just what we needed for a weekend of dog show activities during the day, and cooking out, roasting marshmallows and reading books at night. The hosts were very kind and the entire process was effortless. As the other guests mentioned, Sean met us nearby to show us the best way to the house and made sure we had everything we needed.

Rooms are not very big, but are comfortable for the stay as shown in the listing. Sean and Alan helped us till we settled down. we had only two issues during our stay - smell with hot water inside the kitchen and dampness odor inside the house. Another important note is to be careful at the corners of the cabin corners. It is a family friendly place and has all the facility away from all the hustle and bustle of city life. Thanks Sean and Alan for being the wonderful host and your place is just too good.

He also provided us with loads of information about nearby state parks with hiking, breweries, vineyards, and restaurants. The cabin was cozy and perfect for my group. The beds were a little older and squeaky, but we were so tired by the end of the day that it didn't stop any of us from sleeping well. The fridge was stocked with bottled water just in case we didn't want to drink the well water and we had full access to an outdoor grill and patio and even a chimnea. All in all, this rustic cabin holds a solid place between camping and staying at a hotel.

review_text: My family of six stayed for a night at Jennifer's home. It was one of the top Airbnb's we've stayed in, and we've stayed in over twenty. Jennifer was a great communicator. The home was spotless, comfy, roomy, just a great rest on the road. She graciously extended the check out time so my husband could finish up work on zoom as well. And because it was especially hot, she ran brought us over a brand new fan for the one unairconditioned bedroom which made it very comfortable. Check in, parking and unloading was quick and easy. Also a great location, just a few minutes off 86 but a nice quiet town.

review_text:
My family and I stayed at Jenniferâ€™s Airbnb for 2 nights in June 2021. This was my first experience in renting an Airbnb. Jennifer was very patient as I navigated the website and asked questions!
The accommodations were fabulous! The website was thorough, the photos are realistic and Jennifer did everything possible to make her Airbnb feel like our home.
The kitchen was labeled with everything you would need. The beds were comfortable. The home was newly renovated and very clean!
If we had a question, Jennifer would answer incredibly fast. We would recommend this Airbnb to anyone!
